titles.title: Child Health Care Affordability Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow individuals a credit against income tax for medical expenses for dependents.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/11/2002--Introduced. Child Health Care Affordability Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals a tax credit ($500 or $3,000 per dependent, depending upon the medical care, to be adjusted for inflation) for dependents' unreimbursed medical care expenses. Coordinates such credit with the medical deduction and the employment-related dependent care credit to avoid double benefits.
